description: a(n)^2 is smallest square beginning with n.
comments: Each of the "curves" visible in the scatter plot corresponds to a different nonnegative integer d such that 10^d*n <= a(n)^2 < 10^d*(n+1), and thus a(n) ~ 10^(d/2)*sqrt(n). - _Robert Israel_, Jul 26 2015
links: Zak Seidov, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) >= sqrt(n), for all n > 0 with equality when n is a square. - _Derek Orr_, Jul 26 2015
maple: f:= proc(n) local d,m;  for d from 0 do    m:= ceil(sqrt(10^d*n));    if m^2 < 10^d*(n+1) then return m fi  odend proc:map(f, [$1..100]); # _Robert Israel_, Jul 26 2015
prog: (PARI) a(n)=k=1; while(k,d=digits(k^2); D=digits(n); if(#D<=#d,c=1; for(i=1,#D,if(D[i]!=d[i],c=0;break));if(c,return(k)));k++)vector(100,n,a(n)) \\ _Derek Orr_, Jul 26 2015
author: _David W. Wilson_
